benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/emails/{email} - Delete email from account

covered: Valid Deletion: Extensive coverage of successful deletions (TC01, TC02, TC12, TC13, TC14, TC17, TC18, TC19).
Non-Existent Resource: Coverage for account-not-found and email-not-found scenarios (TC03, TC04, TC09).
Input Validation: Validation of accountId and email formats, missing header, and injection attempts (TC05, TC06, TC07, TC16).
Error Handling: Diverse error responses including 400, 401, 404, 503 across scenarios (TC05, TC06, TC07, TC10, TC11, TC03, TC04, TC09).
Performance and resilience: Response-time check (TC14) and transient failure recovery (TC19).
Regression/Backward compatibility: Uppercase email and legacy client tests (TC17, TC18).
gaps: Soft Deletes: No explicit test for soft-delete semantics (is the delete logical or physical).
Missing Authorization Header: No dedicated test for 401 when the Authorization header is entirely missing (only 400 for missing CreatedBy header).
Rate Limiting: No tests verifying throttling or 429 responses under burst traffic.
Caching Behavior: No tests validating ETag/Cache-Control headers after deletion.
Error payload consistency: Consider standardizing error payloads across scenarios.
recommendations: Add a test to verify soft-delete semantics (e.g., GET should reflect deletion in a non-destructive way or audit log).
Add a dedicated test for missing Authorization header to cover 401 case.
Add rate-limiting tests to ensure proper handling under burst DELETE traffic (expect 429).
Add tests for caching behavior (ETag/Cache-Control) on delete responses.
Standardize error payloads across all error scenarios for consistent messaging.
Consider data-driven tests to cover more emails and accounts, including edge cases like very long emails or unusual characters.
